subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: A new DVR
author: April Abercrombie
full_text:
------=_NextPart_000_0006_01C9C253.F13FE3A0
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

There are some that do have this capability. I believe mine does, though I =
have not used that function. I have the Olympus WM-300. It is a little more=
 expensive brand new, I believe like $160 or something, but I bought mine r=
efurbished for $60.

Anyway, I will try it to make sure, but I am pretty su=
re you can rewind and relisten, not having to go back to the beginning.

Ap=
ril

  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: Frank Sumption 
  To: EVP-ITC@=
yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Monday, April 20, 2009 8:51 PM
  Subject: Re: [EVP=
-ITC] Re: A new DVR






  The only thing I don't like is that the digital=
 recorders don't have que and review funtions that tape decks have, you can=
't back up and re-listen to a voice, you have to go back to the beginning, =
unless the file is copied the computer. 

   BTW, I don't do ghost hunts. 
=

   Frank-S


  On Mon, Apr 20, 2009 at 8:01 PM, April Abercrombie <april@a=
bercrombieghostresearch.com> wrote:





    Oh LOL!! No...you are technica=
lly correct.

    There are 2 instruments that us ghost hunters have in our=
 arsenal that can go by the name of "DVR"; Digital Voice Recorder and Digit=
al Video Recorder.

    To save some confusion, some of us refer to a digit=
al voice recorder as simply a voice recorder. I have gotten so used to this=
 term that I automatically think digital video recorder when I hear DVR.

 =
   I also have an Olympus digital voice recorder. I LOVE it. In fact, I hav=
e had many over the years. I have had other brands too, but Olympus recorde=
rs are the best, as far as the affordable versions go.

    April

      --=
--- Original Message ----- 
      From: purplespacefriend 
      To: EVP-IT=
C@yahoogroups.com 
      Sent: Monday, April 20, 2009 7:40 PM
      Subject=
: [EVP-ITC] Re: A new DVR


      DVR, as in digital voice recorder. I'm no=
t usded to using this new techno stuff, so maybe the terminology is wrong. =
Anyway, I got it at Sams, $60, and it does have an external mic jack. I mad=
e a line to mic level adapter so I can record directly from the boxes. This=
 one has built in USB connector, so it connects directly the PC. It records=
 in WMA format, and that is easliy converted to mp3, or played my windows m=
edia player. 

      F-S

      --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "April Aber=
crombie" <april@...> wrote:
      >
      > You have to tell how much and w=
ere to get one. I need a new DVR for my night vision cameras. I need to be =
able to hook an external mic to it as well, as the cameras do not have audi=
o capability. I was going to buy the Radio Shack one as someone suggested t=
o me. Which would be fine, but I would really like to have USB connection.
=
      > 
      > Does it have an internal harddrive?
      > 
      > April=
 


      > 
      > ----- Original Message ----- 
      > From: Frank Sump=
tion 
      > To: grassharp@yahoogroups.com ; evp-itc@yahoogroups.com 
    =
  > Sent: Sunday, April 19, 2009 9:43 PM
      > Subject: [EVP-ITC] A new D=
VR [7 Attachments]
      > 
      > 
      > [Attachment(s) from Frank Sump=
tion included below] 
      > 
      > 
      > 
      > I bought a Radio S=
hack digital recored years, and never liked it much. I picked up an Olympus=
 WS-21S this afternoon on a whim. I made a line to mic adapter, and did a c=
ouple box recordings. I don't know, might be better than tape. I has the ad=
vantage of of built in USB connector, and it records in WMA format. 
      =
> 
      > I tried a short recording last night using the tones in 51, I do=
n't think they help. 
      > 
      > Frank-S
      >
